file_content.text: Viyo will be glad to know you're okay.
Jedi. You found my son. Thank you.
He told me what you did. He's safe now, and I'm glad his kidnapper is with your Masters.
I hope the Jedi Council can handle him. I suspect he'll be a... difficult student.
Let's trust it works out.
He told me what you did. He's safe now, and I'm glad his kidnapper is dead.
Is Viyo okay? Last I saw, he was leaving the Flesh Raider camp.
How's your son?
Viyo's scars are healing, and the Matriarch will tend to his mind. He'll be well again.
It was necessary.
That Flesh Raider won't harm us again. It's enough.
Just remember--you Pilgrims owe us for this.
You're indebted to Jedi now.
We won't forget.
You have my promise: Whenever the elders speak about the Jedi, I'll speak, too. My son will speak. This is our thanks.
With time, maybe the Jedi and your people can become allies.
It'll lead to good things.
Allies on Tython, and allies against the Flesh Raiders.
Glad to assist.
Be careful--your kid won't be so lucky next time.
Don't mess up again.
I understand. So long as the Flesh Raiders are near, I'll keep my son close.
We wish you well, Jedi. Goodbye, and all the best to you.
Please bring my son back safely. I've done everything I can--it's in your hands, now.
Please don't mock me. Please don't come back without my son.
Jedi! You came! I was afraid--I didn't think you'd make it.
You have to be fast. You have to find my son before he's hurt!
I don't understand. What about your son?
Please explain.
I knelt at the temple gates. I begged for Jedi help. Isn't that why you came?
Just relax.
Oh, I have to, do I? Watch your tongue.
Don't tell me what to do.
Haven't you come to save him? I begged at the temple gates for you.
The Flesh Raiders took him a week ago. They came at twilight. One of them was just... covered in blood and scars. He dragged my son away.
But my son's alive. I don't know why the Flesh Raiders haven't killed him--but I know that you're a Jedi, and you'll save him.
Can't your own people rescue him?
Shouldn't the Pilgrims go?
The Matriarch says we can't attack the Flesh Raider camp to rescue one child. That's why I need you.
Do the Flesh Raiders often come into the village?
Are these attacks common?
Almost never. It was so strange.
Fool.
But you're a Jedi! You're born to help. You're trained to help--it's supposed to be your way!
Listen. Our scouts saw Viyo--my son--on Tythos Ridge. That's where the Raiders have their camp.
They say he's hurt. He's bleeding and limping, but he's alive. He's waiting for rescue.
Even if he was alive, your son might be dead now.
It might be too late.
I know. But if there's a chance he's alive, we have to try and save him.
I'll help you.
I'm not helping.
You can't mean that. You have to help him--before the worst happens.
All right. Nothing worse will happen--I promise.
Very well.
Maybe.
You're a good Jedi. Good and kind.
If you can't find him on Tythos Ridge, look for a sign--something he'd leave behind as a signal. He had his satchel with him. He could leave that.
The Flesh Raiders will try to stop you--but I've seen Jedi fight. Help me, Jedi. Help him.
I'm staying out of this. Your child will have to save himself.
I won't. [Refuse quest]
He can't do that, Jedi. You have to--I just--please leave.
Leave me alone. Leave me be.
